Notes: Men are significantly less likely than women to report subjective under-benefit (that is, perception of fairness)
Objective under-benefit in marriage leads to lesser perception of fairness
More subjective under-benefit (perceived unfairness) if one perceives their spouse to be less intelligent as themselves
Marital quality stays the same for women over years, but for men it increases significantly with each year

Perceiving under-benefit (that is, the feeling that one provides more to the marriage) significantly lowers the perception of marital quality. The effect is significant for both men and women and does not diminish over time
